**Source** [Gamemastery Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=22) pg. 85 Each item level has a price range. Based on the item’s role and abilities, decide where in that range to place it. There’s plenty of variation, and you primarily need to worry about Price only if you expect the PCs will be able to sell it. Primary items cost near the highest value for their level. They have a big impact on combat or player ability. This includes weapons, armor, and Perception items. The highest price is for items like _magic weapons_, _magic armor_, and apex items. So a _+1 striking weapon_ is 100 gp at 4th level. Secondary items, with middle values, give significant secondary benefits or enhance highly consequential noncombat or support skills like Medicine or Crafting. Tertiary items, with low value, are weird or very specific items, ones not usually core to a character’s build. Especially strange ones might fall into the gap between two levels. ## Table 2–19: Permanent Magic Item Price
